column7: Addresses emerging issues and research focused on cities, regions and urbanism, with particular focus on issues pertinent to architecture. Topics may include urban theories, morphological studies, social, political and economic influences in cities, sustainable urbanism, comparative analysis or cities, and urbanism in global contexts. 2 to 4 graduate hours. No professional credit. May be repeated to a maximum of 12 hours. Syllabi for this course vary by instructor and semester. Prerequisite: Graduate Standing.
